attributes.action: make the judiciary answer to government and the general public whom they serve
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Will the Prime Minister please as an urgent measure ensure that the British judiciary are tested on their competence for the job and ensure that they are serving the British public in the way that the public expect them to. The "ludicrous decision" in the case of the Philip Lawrence case is an ideal example of the judiciary making stupid decisions in favour of the perpetrators of crime as they often do, instead of supporting the human rights of the victims. It is high time that the judiciary were made to understand that they are employed by the British public and should answer to them and carry out their wishes.
